intro: Dalibarda repens, commonly known as the creeping basket flower, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, rhizomatous habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a fuzzy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
